topic: How to keep your houseplants alive (even if you forget to water)

sections.title: Intro
sections.narration: Struggle to keep houseplants alive? Here are simple tricks to keep them thriving, even if you forget to water.

visual_suggestions.Action/Context: Medium-sized fiddle-leaf fig plant in a modern ceramic pot on a wooden side table in a living room.
visual_suggestions.Composition: Medium-wide shot, eye-level angle showing plant as main subject.
visual_suggestions.Lighting/Style: Soft morning daylight through nearby window, warm and inviting mood.
visual_suggestions.Quality: Photoreal, high detail, no text or watermarks, clean uncluttered background.

sections.title: Step 1: Pick Hardy Plants
sections.narration: Choose low-maintenance plants like snake plants, pothos, or succulents. They’re forgiving if you miss a watering.

visual_suggestions.Action/Context: Snake plant in tall white pot, pothos trailing from a hanging basket, and small succulent on a windowsill.
visual_suggestions.Composition: Wide shot capturing three plants displayed together for contrast.
visual_suggestions.Lighting/Style: Bright daylight with natural highlights, clean minimalist home interior.
visual_suggestions.Quality: Photoreal, sharp detail, no logos or text.

sections.title: Step 2: Use Self-Watering Pots
sections.narration: Invest in self-watering pots with built-in reservoirs. They release water slowly, keeping soil moist longer.

visual_suggestions.Action/Context: Close-up of a medium ceramic self-watering pot with visible water reservoir at the base.
visual_suggestions.Composition: Tight close-up, slightly angled downward to show reservoir design.
visual_suggestions.Lighting/Style: Soft indoor light with bright natural accents, modern clean style.
visual_suggestions.Quality: Photoreal, high detail, no text overlays.

sections.title: Step 3: Add Moisture-Retaining Soil
sections.narration: Mix soil with perlite or coconut coir. These materials hold moisture without drowning the roots.

visual_suggestions.Action/Context: Hands pouring perlite into dark potting soil inside a terracotta pot on a wooden table.
visual_suggestions.Composition: Overhead shot showing mixture in the pot clearly.
visual_suggestions.Lighting/Style: Bright natural light, crisp clean colors, balanced shadows.
visual_suggestions.Quality: Photoreal, sharp detail, no extra clutter.

sections.title: Step 4: Group Plants Together
sections.narration: Place plants close to each other. They create a mini-humid environment that helps them retain moisture.

visual_suggestions.Action/Context: Cluster of small to medium houseplants like ferns, snake plants, and succulents arranged together on a shelf.
visual_suggestions.Composition: Medium shot, eye-level framing showing group effect.
visual_suggestions.Lighting/Style: Soft daylight, cozy indoor living room style.
visual_suggestions.Quality: Photoreal, high clarity, no text or extra props.

sections.title: Step 5: Use Watering Reminders
sections.narration: Set a phone reminder or use a plant care app to alert you when it’s time to water.

visual_suggestions.Action/Context: Phone screen showing a plant care reminder notification, with a plant on the desk beside it.
visual_suggestions.Composition: Close-up of phone in hand, blurred background plant for context.
visual_suggestions.Lighting/Style: Bright indoor lighting with warm tones.
visual_suggestions.Quality: Photoreal, sharp detail, no text overlays besides app notification.

sections.title: Outro
sections.narration: And that’s it! With hardy plants, self-watering pots, and a few reminders, your plants can thrive with less effort.

visual_suggestions.Action/Context: Happy person sipping coffee near a bright window with healthy green plants in background.
visual_suggestions.Composition: Medium-wide shot, subject slightly off-center with plants in focus.
visual_suggestions.Lighting/Style: Warm morning daylight, calm and positive mood.
visual_suggestions.Quality: Photoreal, high detail, no text or logos.
